user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of UT_Stub_CallOnce:
```c
void UT_Stub_CallOnce(void (*Func)(void))
{
    UT_StubTableEntry_t *StubPtr;
    UT_StubTableEntry_t *OnceEnt;
    UT_EntryKey_t        FuncKey;
    int32                i;

    if (Func == NULL)
    {
        return;
    }

    FuncKey = (UT_EntryKey_t)Func;
    OnceEnt = NULL;
    StubPtr = UT_StubTable;
    for (i = 0; i < UT_MAX_FUNC_STUBS; ++i)
    {
        if (StubPtr->EntryType == UT_ENTRYTYPE_UNUSED && OnceEnt == NULL)
        {
            OnceEnt = StubPtr;
        }
        else if (StubPtr->EntryType == UT_ENTRYTYPE_CALL_ONCE && StubPtr->FuncKey == FuncKey)
        {
            OnceEnt = StubPtr;
            break;
        }
        ++StubPtr;
    }

    if (OnceEnt == NULL)
    {
        /* should never happen -- UT_MAX_FUNC_STUBS needs increase if it does */
        UtAssert_Abort("Cannot do CallOnce - UT_MAX_FUNC_STUBS too low?");
    }
    else if (OnceEnt->EntryType == UT_ENTRYTYPE_UNUSED)
    {
        OnceEnt->EntryType = UT_ENTRYTYPE_CALL_ONCE;
        OnceEnt->FuncKey   = FuncKey;

        Func();
    }
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function UT_Stub_CallOnce:
static UT_StubTableEntry_t UT_StubTable[UT_MAX_FUNC_STUBS] = {{0}}
...
typedef struct
{
    UT_EntryType_t EntryType;
    uint32         ModeFlags;
    UT_EntryKey_t  FuncKey;
    UT_EntryData_t Data;
} UT_StubTableEntry_t
...
typedef cpuaddr UT_EntryKey_t
...
#define UT_MAX_FUNC_STUBS 200
...
void UtAssert_Abort(const char *Message)
{
    UT_BSP_DoText(UTASSERT_CASETYPE_ABORT, Message);
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
The fragments above should be investigated for possible unreachable-code issues: the static zero-initialization of UT_StubTable together with the UNUSED entry value may make the 'OnceEnt == NULL' branch impossible, and the implementation of UtAssert_Abort (which may not return) affects reachability assumptions. The assignment of the first UNUSED entry in the loop influences whether the abort branch can ever be reached, and the cast of the function pointer to an entry key is part of the matching logic that can affect reachability.

Other parts of the function do not need investigation for MISRA Rule 2.1 in this context because they are clearly reachable and normal control flow:
- The initial null check (if (Func == NULL) { return; }) is a reachable defensive check.
- The loop header and increment (++StubPtr; ++i) are standard iteration constructs and not inherently unreachable.
- The branch that matches an existing UT_ENTRYTYPE_CALL_ONCE entry (else if (StubPtr->EntryType == UT_ENTRYTYPE_CALL_ONCE && StubPtr->FuncKey == FuncKey)) is reachable when a prior registration exists.
- The final branch that sets an UNUSED entry to CALL_ONCE and invokes Func() is reachable when an UNUSED slot is found.
These latter fragments implement the intended behavior and do not exhibit obvious unreachable code without further information about enumerator values or whether UtAssert_Abort is non-returning.
